trans-unit.source: Operational Insights Security
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights Security

trans-unit.source: Learn about how Operational Insights protects your privacy and secures your data.
trans-unit.target: Learn about how Operational Insights protects your privacy and secures your data.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights security
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights security

trans-unit.source: Microsoft is committed to protecting your privacy and securing your data, while delivering software and services that help you manage the IT infrastructure of your organization.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft is committed to protecting your privacy and securing your data, while delivering software and services that help you manage the IT infrastructure of your organization.

trans-unit.source: We recognize that when you entrust your data to others, that trust requires rigorous security.
trans-unit.target: We recognize that when you entrust your data to others, that trust requires rigorous security.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft adheres to strict compliance and security guidelines—from coding to operating a service.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft adheres to strict compliance and security guidelines—from coding to operating a service.

trans-unit.source: Securing and protecting data is a top priority at Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Securing and protecting data is a top priority at Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Please contact us with any questions, suggestions, or issues about any of the following information, including our security policies at [Azure support options](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).
trans-unit.target: Please contact us with any questions, suggestions, or issues about any of the following information, including our security policies at [Azure support options](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).

trans-unit.source: This article explains how data is collected, processed, and secured in the Operations Management Suite (OMS).
trans-unit.target: This article explains how data is collected, processed, and secured in the Operations Management Suite (OMS).

trans-unit.source: It was previously called Microsoft Azure Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: It was previously called Microsoft Azure Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: You can use either agents to connect directly to the web service or you can use System Center Operations Manager to collect operational data for the OMS service.
trans-unit.target: You can use either agents to connect directly to the web service or you can use System Center Operations Manager to collect operational data for the OMS service.

trans-unit.source: The collected data is sent over the Internet to the OMS service, which is hosted in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: The collected data is sent over the Internet to the OMS service, which is hosted in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: The OMS service manages your data securely by using the following methods:
trans-unit.target: The OMS service manages your data securely by using the following methods:

trans-unit.source: **Data segregation:** Customer data is kept logically separate on each component throughout the OMS service.
trans-unit.target: **Data segregation:** Customer data is kept logically separate on each component throughout the OMS service.

trans-unit.source: All data is tagged per organization.
trans-unit.target: All data is tagged per organization.

trans-unit.source: This tagging persists throughout the data lifecycle, and it is enforced at each layer of the service.
trans-unit.target: This tagging persists throughout the data lifecycle, and it is enforced at each layer of the service.

trans-unit.source: Each customer has a dedicated Azure blob that houses the long-term data.
trans-unit.target: Each customer has a dedicated Azure blob that houses the long-term data.

trans-unit.source: The blob is encrypted with unique per-customer keys, which are changed every 90 days.
trans-unit.target: The blob is encrypted with unique per-customer keys, which are changed every 90 days.

trans-unit.source: **Data retention:** Aggregated metrics for some of the solutions (previously called intelligence packs), such as Capacity Management, is stored in a SQL Database hosted by Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: **Data retention:** Aggregated metrics for some of the solutions (previously called intelligence packs), such as Capacity Management, is stored in a SQL Database hosted by Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: This data is stored for 390 days.
trans-unit.target: This data is stored for 390 days.

trans-unit.source: Indexed log search data is stored and retained according to the pricing plan.
trans-unit.target: Indexed log search data is stored and retained according to the pricing plan.

trans-unit.source: For more information look at the [Pricing Page](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/operational-insights/)
trans-unit.target: For more information look at the [Pricing Page](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/operational-insights/)

trans-unit.source: **Physical security:** The OMS service is manned by Microsoft personnel and all activities are logged and can be audited.
trans-unit.target: **Physical security:** The OMS service is manned by Microsoft personnel and all activities are logged and can be audited.

trans-unit.source: The OMS service runs completely in Azure and complies with the Azure common engineering criteria.
trans-unit.target: The OMS service runs completely in Azure and complies with the Azure common engineering criteria.

trans-unit.source: You can view details about the physical security of Azure assets on page 18 of the [Microsoft Azure Security Overview](http://download.microsoft.com/download/6/0/2/6028B1AE-4AEE-46CE-9187-641DA97FC1EE/Windows%20Azure%20Security%20Overview%20v1.01.pdf).
trans-unit.target: You can view details about the physical security of Azure assets on page 18 of the [Microsoft Azure Security Overview](http://download.microsoft.com/download/6/0/2/6028B1AE-4AEE-46CE-9187-641DA97FC1EE/Windows%20Azure%20Security%20Overview%20v1.01.pdf).

trans-unit.source: **Compliance and certifications:** The OMS software development and service team is actively working with the Microsoft Legal and Compliance teams and other industry partners to acquire a variety of certifications, including ISO.
trans-unit.target: **Compliance and certifications:** The OMS software development and service team is actively working with the Microsoft Legal and Compliance teams and other industry partners to acquire a variety of certifications, including ISO.

trans-unit.source: We currently meet the following security standards:
trans-unit.target: We currently meet the following security standards:

trans-unit.source: Windows Common Engineering Criteria
trans-unit.target: Windows Common Engineering Criteria

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Trustworthy Computing Certification
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Trustworthy Computing Certification

trans-unit.source: Data flow security
trans-unit.target: Data flow security

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows the flow of information from your company and how it is secured as is moves to the OMS service, ultimately seen by you in OMS.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the flow of information from your company and how it is secured as is moves to the OMS service, ultimately seen by you in OMS.

trans-unit.source: More information about each step follows the diagram.
trans-unit.target: More information about each step follows the diagram.

trans-unit.source: Image of OMS data collection and security
trans-unit.target: Image of OMS data collection and security

trans-unit.source: 1. Sign up for OMS and collect data
trans-unit.target: 1. Sign up for OMS and collect data

trans-unit.source: For your organization to send data to the OMS service, you must either configure Microsoft Monitoring agents when connecting directly to the web service or use a configuration wizard in the Operations console in Operations Manager.
trans-unit.target: For your organization to send data to the OMS service, you must either configure Microsoft Monitoring agents when connecting directly to the web service or use a configuration wizard in the Operations console in Operations Manager.

trans-unit.source: Users (which might be you, other individual users, or a group of people) must create one or more OMS accounts and register either each directly-connected agent or their Operations Manager environment by using one of the following accounts:
trans-unit.target: Users (which might be you, other individual users, or a group of people) must create one or more OMS accounts and register either each directly-connected agent or their Operations Manager environment by using one of the following accounts:

trans-unit.source: Organizational ID
trans-unit.target: Organizational ID

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Account - Outlook, Office Live, MSN
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Account - Outlook, Office Live, MSN

trans-unit.source: An OMS account is where data is collected, aggregated, analyzed, and presented.
trans-unit.target: An OMS account is where data is collected, aggregated, analyzed, and presented.

trans-unit.source: An OMS account is primarily used as a means to partition data, and each OMS account is unique.
trans-unit.target: An OMS account is primarily used as a means to partition data, and each OMS account is unique.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want to have your production data managed with one OMS account and your test data managed with another account.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want to have your production data managed with one OMS account and your test data managed with another account.

trans-unit.source: Accounts also help an administrator control user access to the data.
trans-unit.target: Accounts also help an administrator control user access to the data.

trans-unit.source: Each OMS account can have multiple user accounts associated with it, and each user account can have multiple OMS accounts.
trans-unit.target: Each OMS account can have multiple user accounts associated with it, and each user account can have multiple OMS accounts.

trans-unit.source: When the configuration wizard is complete, each Operations Manager management group establishes a connection with the OMS service.
trans-unit.target: When the configuration wizard is complete, each Operations Manager management group establishes a connection with the OMS service.

trans-unit.source: You then use the Add Computers Wizard to choose which computers in the management group are allowed to send data to the service.
trans-unit.target: You then use the Add Computers Wizard to choose which computers in the management group are allowed to send data to the service.

trans-unit.source: Both types of agents collect data for OMS.
trans-unit.target: Both types of agents collect data for OMS.

trans-unit.source: The type of data that is collected is dependent on the types of solutions used.
trans-unit.target: The type of data that is collected is dependent on the types of solutions used.

trans-unit.source: A solution is a bundle of predefined views, log search queries, data collection rules, and processing logic.
trans-unit.target: A solution is a bundle of predefined views, log search queries, data collection rules, and processing logic.

trans-unit.source: Only OMS administrators can use OMS to import a solution.
trans-unit.target: Only OMS administrators can use OMS to import a solution.

trans-unit.source: After the solution is imported, it is moved to the Operations Manager management servers (if used), and then to the Operations Manager agents that you have chosen.
trans-unit.target: After the solution is imported, it is moved to the Operations Manager management servers (if used), and then to the Operations Manager agents that you have chosen.

trans-unit.source: Afterward, the agents collect the data.
trans-unit.target: Afterward, the agents collect the data.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the available solutions in OMS and the types of data they collect.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the available solutions in OMS and the types of data they collect.

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.target: Data types

trans-unit.target: Configuration Assessment

trans-unit.target: Capacity Planning

trans-unit.target: Performance data, metadata, and state data

trans-unit.target: Antimalware

trans-unit.source: Configuration data, metadata, and state data
trans-unit.target: Configuration data, metadata, and state data

trans-unit.target: System Update Assessment

trans-unit.target: Metadata and state data

trans-unit.target: Log Management

trans-unit.target: User-defined event logs

trans-unit.target: Change Tracking

trans-unit.target: Software inventory and Windows service metadata

trans-unit.target: SQL and Active Directory Assessment

trans-unit.source: WMI data, registry data, performance data, and SQL Server dynamic management view results
trans-unit.target: WMI data, registry data, performance data, and SQL Server dynamic management view results

trans-unit.target: The following table shows examples of data types:

trans-unit.target: Data type

trans-unit.target: Fields

trans-unit.target: Alert

trans-unit.target: Alert Name, Alert Description, BaseManagedEntityId, Problem ID, IsMonitorAlert, RuleId, ResolutionState, Priority, Severity, Category, Owner, ResolvedBy, TimeRaised, TimeAdded, LastModified, LastModifiedBy, LastModifiedExceptRepeatCount, TimeResolved, TimeResolutionStateLastModified, TimeResolutionStateLastModifiedInDB, RepeatCount

trans-unit.source: Event
trans-unit.target: Event

trans-unit.source: When you log events with custom fields into the Windows event log, OMS collects them.
trans-unit.target: When you log events with custom fields into the Windows event log, OMS collects them.

trans-unit.target: Metadata

trans-unit.target: State

trans-unit.target: StateChangeEventId, StateId, NewHealthState, OldHealthState, Context, TimeGenerated, TimeAdded, StateId2, BaseManagedEntityId, MonitorId, HealthState, LastModified, LastGreenAlertGenerated, DatabaseTimeModified

trans-unit.source: 2. Send data from agents
trans-unit.target: 2. Send data from agents

trans-unit.source: With agents that connect directly to the web service, you register them with a key and a secure connection is established between the agent and the OMS service by using port 443.
trans-unit.target: With agents that connect directly to the web service, you register them with a key and a secure connection is established between the agent and the OMS service by using port 443.

trans-unit.source: With Operations Manager, you register an account with the OMS service and a secure HTTPS connection is established between the Operations Manager management server and the OMS service by using port 443.
trans-unit.target: With Operations Manager, you register an account with the OMS service and a secure HTTPS connection is established between the Operations Manager management server and the OMS service by using port 443.

trans-unit.source: If Operations Manager is unable to communicate to the service for any reason, the collected data is stored in a temporary cache and the management server tries to resend the data every 8 minutes for 2 hours.
trans-unit.target: If Operations Manager is unable to communicate to the service for any reason, the collected data is stored in a temporary cache and the management server tries to resend the data every 8 minutes for 2 hours.

trans-unit.source: Collected data is compressed and sent to the OMS service, bypassing on-premises databases, so it does not add any load to them.
trans-unit.target: Collected data is compressed and sent to the OMS service, bypassing on-premises databases, so it does not add any load to them.

trans-unit.source: After the collected data is sent, it is removed from the cache.
trans-unit.target: After the collected data is sent, it is removed from the cache.

trans-unit.source: 3. The OMS service receives and processes data
trans-unit.target: 3. The OMS service receives and processes data

trans-unit.source: The OMS service ensures that incoming data is from a trusted source by validating certificates and the data integrity.
trans-unit.target: The OMS service ensures that incoming data is from a trusted source by validating certificates and the data integrity.

trans-unit.source: The unprocessed raw data is then stored as a blob in [Microsoft Azure Storage](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/storage/).
trans-unit.target: The unprocessed raw data is then stored as a blob in [Microsoft Azure Storage](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/storage/).

trans-unit.source: Each OMS user has a dedicated Azure blob, which is accessible only to that user.
trans-unit.target: Each OMS user has a dedicated Azure blob, which is accessible only to that user.

trans-unit.source: The type of data that is stored is dependent on the types of solutions that were imported and used to collect data.
trans-unit.target: The type of data that is stored is dependent on the types of solutions that were imported and used to collect data.

trans-unit.source: The OMS service processes the raw data, and the aggregated processed data is stored in a SQL database.
trans-unit.target: The OMS service processes the raw data, and the aggregated processed data is stored in a SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Communication between the OMS service and SQL database relies on SQL database authentication.
trans-unit.target: Communication between the OMS service and SQL database relies on SQL database authentication.

trans-unit.source: 4. Use OMS to access the data
trans-unit.target: 4. Use OMS to access the data

trans-unit.source: You can sign in to OMS by using the account you set up previously.
trans-unit.target: You can sign in to OMS by using the account you set up previously.

trans-unit.source: All traffic between OMS and the OMS service is sent over a secure HTTPS channel.
trans-unit.target: All traffic between OMS and the OMS service is sent over a secure HTTPS channel.
